content.question: Which of the following expressions can be used to determine the magnitude of the impulse on object <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="m sub 2 times, open parenthesis, v sub 2 f, end sub, minus v sub 2 i, end sub, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>f</mi></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>i</mi></mrow></msub></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="m sub 1 times, open parenthesis, v sub 2 f, end sub, minus v sub 2 i, end sub, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>f</mi></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>i</mi></mrow></msub></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="m sub 2 times, open parenthesis, v sub 1 f, end sub, minus v sub 1 i, end sub, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mi>f</mi></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mi>i</mi></mrow></msub></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 2 times m sub 1, end sub, times v sub 1 i, end sub, and denominator, open parenthesis, m sub 1 plus m sub 2, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mi>i</mi></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, m sub 1 minus m sub 2, close parenthesis, times v sub 1 i, end sub, and denominator, open parenthesis, m sub 1 plus m sub 2, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mi>i</mi></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="m sub 2 times, open parenthesis, v sub 2 f, end sub, minus v sub 2 i, end sub, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>f</mi></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>i</mi></mrow></msub></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
